channel.title: VPS Questions Simple
channel.description: 1. Are VPS's already Portfarwarded 2. Can i edit my client to the IP of the VPS 3. Or do i first need to cover it whit a No-Ip.org Host

item.title: VPS Questions Simple
item.dc:creator: @rova1 rova1
item.description:
@rova1 wrote:

[quote=“joellol, post:1, topic:351858”]1. Are VPS’s already Portfarwarded
2. Can i edit my client to the IP of the VPS
3. Or do i first need to cover it whit a No-Ip.org Host[/quote]

  1. they don’t need to be ‘portforwarded’
  2. yes you can
  3. you don’t need to but I recommend doing it anyway

Read full topic

item.title: VPS Questions Simple
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

[quote=“Epic Steve, post:6, topic:351858”][quote author=usman555 link=topic=448213.msg3289450#msg3289450 date=1280440705]

  1. All topics in this section must be requests for help on a server. Any non-server related questions will be locked. Requesting a host, ‘coder’/programmer, server or client, or asking about a VPS also falls under being non-server related. That means for other sections on this site too.
    [/quote]O rly?

All topics in this section must be requests for help on a server[/quote]Sooo wouldn’t it be a new rule to specifiy VPS talk? Because to me it looks like this is a requests rule.

Read full topic

1. All topics in this section must be [b]requests[/b] for help on a server. Any non-server related questions will be locked. Requesting a host, 'coder'/programmer, server or client, or asking about a VPS also falls under being non-server related. That means for other sections on this site too.
O rly?
